title: The Ground Proximity WarningWindshear systems provides the f…
caption_en: The Ground Proximity WarningWindshear systems provides the flight crew with aural and visual warnings of potentially dangerous flight path relative to ground and of windshear conditions. The system is operable between 30 to ft radio altitude.

title: system consists of a computer which is installed in the cabi…
caption_en: system consists of a computer which is installed in the cabin baggage compartment, and the associated annunciator switches and annunciators.

title: The computer recieves the following inputs: ADC, AHRS, NAV, …
caption_en: The computer recieves the following inputs: ADC, AHRS, NAV, flap position, landing gear position, radio altimeter and stall warning vane position.

title: The warning outputs consist of both aural and visual. The au…
caption_en: The warning outputs consist of both aural and visual. The aural warnings can be heard over the cockpit speakers and headphones. The visual warnings will illuminate the relevant warning lights on the annunciators.

title: The aural warnings generated by system have priority over au…
caption_en: The aural warnings generated by system have priority over aural warnings generated by all crew warning panel aural alerts.

title: Each mode provides aural and visual warnings of possible ter…
caption_en: Each mode provides aural and visual warnings of possible terrain danger under the following conditions:

title: Mode 1 provides warnings for excessive decent rates with res…
caption_en: Mode 1 provides warnings for excessive decent rates with respect to radio altitude. This mode has an inner and outer warning boundary. Penetration of the outer warning boundary illuminate the PULL UP annunciators and activates the 'SINK RATE' message. The voice message will occur at least twice and will not repeat unless penetration increases.

title: Penetration to the inner boundary leaves the PULL UP annunci…
caption_en: Penetration to the inner boundary leaves the PULL UP annunciators on, but changes the voice message to PULL UP which repeats continuously until the inner warning boundary is exited.

title: If a valid ILS glideslope front course signal is received an…
caption_en: If a valid ILS glideslope front course signal is received and the aircraft is above the glideslope centreline, the outer (sinkrate) boundary is adjusted to desensitize the sinkrate alert boundary to prevent unwanted alerts when the aircraft is safely capturing the glideslope from above the beam.

title: Mode 2 provides alerts and warnings to help protect the airc…
caption_en: Mode 2 provides alerts and warnings to help protect the aircraft from impacting the ground when rapidly rising terrain with respect to the aircraft is detected. Mode 2 is based on radio altitude and on how rapidly radio altitude is decreasing (closure rate). Mode 2 exists in two forms: 2A and 2B

title: Mode 2A is active during climbout, cruise and initial approa…
caption_en: Mode 2A is active during climbout, cruise and initial approach (flaps not in landing configuration and aircraft not on glideslope centreline)

title: If the aircraft penetrates the Mode 2A alerting envelope, th…
caption_en: If the aircraft penetrates the Mode 2A alerting envelope, the PULL UP annunciators will illuminate and the "TERRAIN TERRAIN voice warning will sound.

title: If the aircraft continues to penetrate the envelope, the war…
caption_en: If the aircraft continues to penetrate the envelope, the warning message 'PULL UP" is repeated continuously until the warning envelope is exited.

title: Upon exiting the warning envelope, if the terrain clearance …
caption_en: Upon exiting the warning envelope, if the terrain clearance continue to decrease, the aurall message TERRAIN TERRAIN' will be given until the terrain clearance stops decreasing.

title: The PULL UP annunciators will remain on until one of the fol…
caption_en: The PULL UP annunciators will remain on until one of the following conditions is achieved: 1) ft of pressure altitude is gained.

title: 2) A safe altitude above ground level is maintained for a sh…
caption_en: 2) A safe altitude above ground level is maintained for a short time.

title: The FLAP OVRD switch is activated.
caption_en: The FLAP OVRD switch is activated.

title: Mode 2B provides a desensitized alerting envelope to permit …
caption_en: Mode 2B provides a desensitized alerting envelope to permit normal landing approach maneouvres close to terrain without unwanted alerts. Mode 2B is automatically selected with flaps in landing configuration or when making an ILS approach with glideslope and localizer deviation less than 2 dots.

title: During an approach, if the aircraft penetrates the Mode 2B e…
caption_en: During an approach, if the aircraft penetrates the Mode 2B envelope with either the gear or the flaps notin the landing configuration, the PULL UP annunciators illuminate and the "TERRAIN, TERRIAN' aural warning will sound.

title: If the aircraft continues to penetrate the envelope, the aud…
caption_en: If the aircraft continues to penetrate the envelope, the audio message PULL UP is repeated continuously until the warning envelope is exited.

title: If the aircraft penetrates the Mode 2B envelope with both ge…
caption_en: If the aircraft penetrates the Mode 2B envelope with both gear and flaps in the landing configuration, PULL UP aural warnings are suppressed and the audio message TERRAIN is repeated until the envelope is exited.

title: Mode 3 warning is given for significant altitude loss after …
caption_en: Mode 3 warning is given for significant altitude loss after a takeoff. It is active once the aircraft reaches 30 ft RA and it provides warnings until the aircraft exceeds ft RA.

title: This mode is also active if a go-around is initiated from be…
caption_en: This mode is also active if a go-around is initiated from below ft RA with gear and flaps in the landing configuration. Raising the gear andor flaps signals the system that go-around has been initiated.

title: If the aircraft loses altitude following take-off or go-arou…
caption_en: If the aircraft loses altitude following take-off or go-around, the PULL UP annunciators illuminate and the DON'T SINK' voice warning activates. The voice message is repeated twice unless altitude loss continues to accumulate.

title: Mode 4 warning is given for insufficient terrain clearance w…
caption_en: Mode 4 warning is given for insufficient terrain clearance with respect to aircraft configuration and airspeed. These warnings are given even with low closure rates. Three types of warnings are given under this mode: 4A, 4B and

title: Mode 4A is active during cruise and approach with gear up. T…
caption_en: Mode 4A is active during cruise and approach with gear up. This provides alerting during cruise for inadvertent flight into terrain where terrain is not rising significantly, or the aircraft is not descending excessively. During approach, Mode 4A provides alerting for protection against an unintentional gear-up landing.

title: If the aircraft penetrates ft RA with a speed above kts, the…
caption_en: If the aircraft penetrates ft RA with a speed above kts, the PULL UP annunciators illuminate and the TOO LOW TERRAIN will sound.

title: If the speed is slowed down to below kts with gear still up,…
caption_en: If the speed is slowed down to below kts with gear still up, the aural warning will change to "TOO LOW GEAR'.

title: Mode 4B is active during cruise and approach with gear down …
caption_en: Mode 4B is active during cruise and approach with gear down and flaps not landing configuration. If the aircraft penetrates ft RA and the speed is above kts, the PULL UP annunciators will illuminate and 'TOO LOW TERRAIN will sound.

title: If the speed of the aircraft slows down to below kts with th…
caption_en: If the speed of the aircraft slows down to below kts with the flaps still not in landing configuration, then the aural warning will change to "TOO LOW FLAP".

title: Mode 4C alerts the crew when the terrain is rising more stee…
caption_en: Mode 4C alerts the crew when the terrain is rising more steeply than the aircraft is climbing. It is based on the minimum terrain clearance, or floor, that increases with radio altitude that has occurred during takeoff. It is active from ft RA and provide warning until aircraft exceeds ft RA. This mode is also active if go-around is initiated from below ft RA.

title: If the aircraft penetrates the floor, the PULL UP annunciato…
caption_en: If the aircraft penetrates the floor, the PULL UP annunciators illuminate and the 'TOO LOW TERRAIN voice warning is given. The warning will be repeated only if the aircraft penetrates further into the envelope.

title: Mode 5 is armed when the landing lever is down, glideslope i…
caption_en: Mode 5 is armed when the landing lever is down, glideslope is within 2 dots of nominal, and RA is 30 ft to ft. The alert occurs at two audio levels; soft and hard alert areas.

title: Mode 5 can be disarmed by pushing the GS INHB switch on the …
caption_en: Mode 5 can be disarmed by pushing the GS INHB switch on the pedestal. When the switch is pushed, ON is illuminated on the switch.

title: When the glideslope deviation reaches dot fiy-up, the BELOW …
caption_en: When the glideslope deviation reaches dot fiy-up, the BELOW G annunciators will illuminate and the softer 'GLIDESLOPE' voice (at half the volume level) alert will be given. The GLIDESLOPE' voice alert in the 'soft area will be given once and repeated only if the conditon worsens.

title: Below ft RA and deviation of dots fly-up or more, the louder…
caption_en: Below ft RA and deviation of dots fly-up or more, the louder GLIDESLOPE' voice alert is given. A '"GLIDESLOPE' alert in the louder area will be repeated at an increased rate.

title: Mode 7 windshear warnings and cautions are provided between …
caption_en: Mode 7 windshear warnings and cautions are provided between 30 and ft AGL initial takeoff and between and 10 ft AGL during the final approach phases of flight when the level of windshear exceeds predetermined threshold values.

title: The actual windshear value which is measured represents the …
caption_en: The actual windshear value which is measured represents the vector sum of inertial and air mass accelerations along the flight path and perpendicular to the flight path. These shears result from vertical winds and rapidly changing horizontal winds.

title: Windshear warnings are given for decreasing headwind (or inc…
caption_en: Windshear warnings are given for decreasing headwind (or increasing tailwind) and severe vertical downdrafts.

title: Windshear warnings activate the annunciators and the "siren …
caption_en: Windshear warnings activate the annunciators and the "siren WINDSHEAR, WINDSHEAR, WINDSHEAR' voice warning. The voice warning will not repeat unless another event occurs, but the warning annunciators remain on for as long as the decreasing headwinddowndraft condition persists.

title: Windshear cautions are given for increasing headwind (or dec…
caption_en: Windshear cautions are given for increasing headwind (or decreasing tailwind) and vertical updrafts typically associated with the leading edge of microburst windshear.

title: Windshear cautions activate the amber annunciators. The caut…
caption_en: Windshear cautions activate the amber annunciators. The caution annunciators remain on for as long as the increasing headwindupdraft condition persists.

title: The test consists of two levels of test. To perform first le…
caption_en: The test consists of two levels of test. To perform first level of test on the system, 1) rotate the TESTRESET switch to 2) depress and release TEST switch.

title: The following will be observed: Amber FAIL and amber FAIL an…
caption_en: The following will be observed: Amber FAIL and amber FAIL annunciators illuminate on pilot and co-pilot instrument panels and remain on throughout test.

title: Amber BELOW GS annunciators illuminate on pilot and co-pilot…
caption_en: Amber BELOW GS annunciators illuminate on pilot and co-pilot instrument panels and 'GLIDESLOPE' voice message sounds. BELOW GIS annunciators extinguish after that.

title: Red PULL UP annunciators illuminate on both sides, one 'PULL…
caption_en: Red PULL UP annunciators illuminate on both sides, one 'PULL UP voice message sounds, then PULL UP annunciators extinguish.

title: Red annunciators illuminate on both sides and 'SIREN WIND SH…
caption_en: Red annunciators illuminate on both sides and 'SIREN WIND SHEAR WINDSHEAR WIND SHEAR' voice message sounds. annunciators extinguish after that.

title: Amber annunciators illuminate on pilot and co-pilot instrume…
caption_en: Amber annunciators illuminate on pilot and co-pilot instrument panels for approximately seconds.

title: Lastly, FAIL and FAIL annunciators extinguish on both sides.
caption_en: Lastly, FAIL and FAIL annunciators extinguish on both sides.

title: The second level of test is carried out by pressing and hold…
caption_en: The second level of test is carried out by pressing and holding the TEST switch for 2 seconds. This will activate and perform the first level test initially. However, before FAIL and FAIL annunciators extinguish, the following voice messages are heard.

title: Slide 51
Following the announcement of these messages, the FAIL and F…
caption_en: Following the announcement of these messages, the FAIL and FAIL annunciators extinguish.
